section.name: Crystal Lattice And Periodic Boundary
section.subsection: [real] Sets the value of the a-axis length for a crystal unit cell, or, equivalently, the X-axis length for a periodic box. The length value in Angstroms is listed after the keyword.
[real] Sets the value of the b-axis length for a crystal unit cell, or, equivalently, the Y-axis length for a periodic box. The length value in Angstroms is listed after the keyword.

[real] Sets the value of the C-axis length for a crystal unit cell, or, equivalently, the Z-axis length for a periodic box. The length value in Angstroms is listed after the keyword. If the keyword is DEFAULT, the C-axis length is set equal to the A-axis length.

[real] Sets the value of the α-angle of a crystal unit cell, i.e., the angle between the b-axis and c-axis of a unit cell, or, equivalently, the angle between the Y-axis and Z-axis of a periodic box. The default value in the absence of the ALPHA keyword is 90 degrees.

[real] Sets the value of the β-angle of a crystal unit cell, i.e., the angle between the a-axis and c-axis of a unit cell, or, equivalently, the angle between the X-axis and Z-axis of a periodic box. The default value in the absence of the BETA keyword is to set the β-angle equal to the α-angle as given by the keyword ALPHA.

[real] Sets the value of the γ-angle of a crystal unit cell, i.e., the angle between the a-axis and b-axis of a unit cell, or, equivalently, the angle between the X-axis and Z-axis of a periodic box. The default value in the absence of the GAMMA keyword is to set the γ-angle equal to the α-angle as given by the keyword ALPHA.
[name] This keyword selects the space group to be used in manipulation of crystal unit cells and asymmetric units. The name option must be chosen from one of the following currently.

section.name: Force Field Selection
section.subsection: [name] This keyword provides a name for the force field to be used in the current calculation. Its value is usually set in the master force field parameter file for the calculation (see the PARAMETERS keyword) instead of in the keyfile.

[file name] Provides the name of the force field parameter file to be used for the current TINKER calculation. The standard file name extension for parameter files (.prm) is an optional part of the file name modifier. The default in the absence of the PARAMETERS keyword is to look for a parameter file with the same base name as the molecular system and ending in the .prm extension. If a valid parameter file is not found, the user will asked to provide a file name interactively.

section.name: Potential Function Selection
section.subsection: This keyword controls use of the bond angle bending potential energy term. In the absence of a modifying option, this keyword turns on use of the potential. TRUE/FALSE turns on/off use of this potential energy term, otherwise use the DEFAULT behavior for the chosen force field.

This keyword controls use of the bond stretching potential energy term. In the absence of a modifying option, this keyword turns on use of the potential. TRUE/FALSE turns on/off use of this potential energy term, otherwise use the DEFAULT behavior for the chosen force field.

This keyword controls use of the generalized Kirkwood implicit solvent. In the absence of a modifying option, this keyword turns on use of the GK potential. TRUE/FALSE turns on/off use of this potential energy term, otherwise use the DEFAULT behavior FALSE.

This keyword controls use of the atomic multipole electrostatics potential energy term. In the absence of a modifying option, this keyword turns on use of the potential. TRUE/FALSE turns on/off use of this potential energy term, otherwise use the DEFAULT behavior for the chosen force field.

This keyword controls use of the Allinger MM-style outof- plane bending potential energy term. In the absence of a modifying option, this keyword turns on use of the potential. TRUE/FALSE turns on/off use of this potential energy term, otherwise use the DEFAULT behavior for the chosen force field.

This keyword controls use of the out-of-plane distance potential energy term. In the absence of a modifying option, this keyword turns on use of the potential. TRUE/FALSE turns on/off use of this potential energy term, otherwise use the DEFAULT behavior for the chosen force field.

This keyword controls use of the atomic dipole polarization potential energy term. In the absence of a modifying option, this keyword turns on use of the potential. TRUE/FALSE turns on/off use of this potential energy term, otherwise use the DEFAULT behavior for the chosen force field.

This keyword controls use of the macroscopic solvation potential energy term. In the absence of a modifying option, this keyword turns on use of the potential. TRUE/FALSE turns on/off use of this potential energy term, otherwise use the DEFAULT behavior for the chosen force field.

This keyword controls use of the bond stretching-angle bending cross term potential energy. In the absence of a modifying option, this keyword turns on use of the potential. TRUE/FALSE turns on/off use of this potential energy term, otherwise use the DEFAULT behavior for the chosen force field.

This keyword controls use of the torsional angle potential energy term. In the absence of a modifying option, this keyword turns on use of the potential. TRUE/FALSE turns on/off use of this potential energy term, otherwise use the DEFAULT behavior for the chosen force field.

This keyword controls use of the torsion-torsion potential energy term. In the absence of a modifying option, this keyword turns on use of the potential. TRUE/FALSE turns on/off use of this potential energy term, otherwise use the DEFAULT behavior for the chosen force field.

This keyword controls use of the Urey-Bradley potential energy term. In the absence of a modifying option, this keyword turns on use of the potential. TRUE/FALSE turns on/off use of this potential energy term, otherwise use the DEFAULT behavior for the chosen force field.

This keyword controls use of the van der Waals repulsion-dispersion potential energy term. In the absence of a modifying option, this keyword turns on use of the potential. TRUE/FALSE turns on/off use of this potential energy term, otherwise use the DEFAULT behavior for the chosen force field.

section.name: Non-Bonded Force Field
section.subsection: Specifies the Ewald convergence parameter. The default is 0.545.
Specifies the cut-off for the real space portion of PME. The default is 7.0 Angstroms.
Specifies the self-consistent field convergence criteria. The default is 1.0e-5 RMS Debye.
Specifies the number of mesh points along the a-axis. The default is a-axis * pme-mesh-density.
Specifies the number of mesh points along the b-axis. The default is b-axis * pme-mesh-density.
Specifies the number of mesh points along the c-axis. The default is c-axis * pme-mesh-density.
Specifies the number of mesh points per Angstrom for the reciprocal space mesh. The default is 1.2.
Specifies the PME b-Spline order, which must be greater than or equal to 5 for AMOEBA. The default is 5.
Specifies the van der Waals cut-off radius. The default is 12.0 Angstroms.

section.name: X-ray Refinement
section.subsection: Title of the Fo column in the input MTZ file (if it is not one of the default values of F, Fo, Fp or Fobs).
Title of the sigFo column in the input MTZ file (if it is not one of the default values of sigF, sigFo, sigFp or SigFobs).
Title of the Rfree column in the input MTZ file (if it is not one of the default values of Rfree, freeR, freeRflag, Rfreeflag, test, freer_flag or R-free-flags).
Uses 3 Gaussians in form factor equation rather than 6 (set to false for atomic resolution data).
Atom radius buffer for sampling grid density, added to dynamically determined radius.
Apply a resolution dependent spline fit between Fo and Fc.
F/sigF cutoff (negative: all values read in).
Resolution cutoff (negative: all data read in).
Integer flag for Rfree reflections (negative: automatically determined from data).
Number of bins to divide data into for purposes of statistics/sigmaA fits.
Grid over bulk solvent parameters to determine optimal starting values.
Gradient rms tolerance for scaling.
Gradient rms tolerance for sigmaA fit.
Weight for summed diffraction data (weights for individual data sets are provided at the script level).
Harmonic restraint B-factor weight between bonded atoms (increase to 5 or 10 for low resolution structures if necessary)
Entropy term to prevent nonzero B factors.
Fictitious mass to assign to B factors for extended Lagrangian methods.
Set to true to refine a B factor for each residue.
Number of residues per B factor (requires residuebfactor to be true).
Set to true to add ANISOU records to the PDB file based on isotropic B factors.
Set to true to refine occupancies of HETATMs, only performed if hetatms are in alternate conformers or occ less than 1.0.
Fictitious mass to assign to occupancies for extended Lagrangian methods.
